entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Through the Weekend... Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt will cause rivers draining the Brooks Range to rise to bankfull and possibly overbank in some low lying areas into the weekend. The high water will cover gravel bars and push water up to the brush line. Those living or recreating along rivers draining the Brooks Range are

entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Idaho... Big Lost River near Arco affecting Butte County. .Heavy, recent rainfall combined with high mountain snow have caused high inflows into the Mackay reservoir, which is prompting high releases downstream of the reservoir.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 2:51AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 10 at 3:26AM CDT until June 10 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 10 at 3:22AM CDT until June 12 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 6 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, and Ozaukee counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 10 at 3:22AM CDT until June 12 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 4 to 8 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 11:25AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .High-elevation snowmelt continues and automated snowpack estimates reveal about 5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet west of La Barge. Approximately 1 inch

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 11:14AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,500 feet, continues.
